Definition: The user-defined name for the sample.
Guidance: The sample_ID should represent the identifier assigned to the sample at time of collection, for which all the descriptive information applies. If the original sample_ID is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: An alternative sample_ID assigned to the sample by another organization.
Guidance: Provide any alternative identifiers for the sample here, separated by commas. Alternative identifiers assigned to the sample should be tracked along with original IDs to establish chain of custody. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the organization with which the sample collector is affiliated.
Guidance: Provide the name of the agency, organization or institution that collected the sample in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The specific laboratory affiliation of the sample collector.
Guidance: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that collected the sample (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the project/initiative/program for which the sample was collected.
Guidance: Provide the name of the project and/or the project ID here. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the study design for a surveillance project.
Guidance: Provide the name of the sample plan used for sample collection. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.
Examples: National Microbiological Baseline Study in Broiler Chicken

Definition: The identifier of the study design for a surveillance project.
Guidance: Provide the identifier of the sample plan used for sample collection. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name or job title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more preferable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
Guidance: Provide the email associated with the listed contact. As personnel turnover may render an individual's email obsolete, it is more preferable to provide an address for a position or lab, to ensure accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The reason that the sample was collected.
Guidance: The reason a sample was collected may provide information about potential biases in sampling strategy. Provide the purpose of sampling from the picklist in the template. Most likely, the sample was collected for Diagnostic testing. The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing, which should be indicated in the "purpose of sequencing" field.

Definition: The activities or variables introduced upstream of sample collection that may affect the sample collected.
Guidance: If there was presampling activity that would affect the sample prior to collection (this is different than sample processing which happens after the sample is collected), provide the experimental activities by selecting one or more values from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The details of the activities or variables introduced upstream of sample collection that may affect the sample collected.
Guidance: Briefly describe the presampling activity details using free text.
Examples: Chicken feed containing X amount of novobiocin was fed to chickens for 72 hours prior to collection of litter.

Definition: The processing applied to samples post-collection, prior to further testing, characterization, or isolation procedures.
Guidance: Provide the sample processing information by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The country of origin of the sample.
Guidance: Provide the name of the country where the sample was collected. Use the controlled vocabulary provided in the template pick list.  If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, provide a null value.

Definition: The state/province/territory of origin of the sample.
Guidance: Provide the name of the province/state/region where the sample was collected.  If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, provide a null value.

Definition: The name of a specific geographical location e.g. Credit River (rather than river).
Guidance: Provide the name of the specific geographical site using a specific noun (a word that names a certain place, thing).

Definition: The country of origin of a food product.
Guidance: If a food product was sampled and the food product was manufactured outside of Canada, provide the name of the country where the food product originated by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The country of origin of the host.
Guidance: If a sample is from a human or animal host that originated from outside of Canada, provide the the name of the country where the host originated by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The latitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
Guidance: If known, provide the degrees latitude.  Do NOT simply provide latitude of the institution if this is not where the sample was collected, nor the centre of the city/region where the sample was collected as this falsely implicates an existing geographical location and creates data inaccuracies. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
Guidance: If known, provide the degrees longitude.  Do NOT simply provide longitude of the institution if this is not where the sample was collected, nor the centre of the city/region where the sample was collected as this falsely implicates an existing geographical location and creates data inaccuracies. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The date on which the sample was collected.
Guidance: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

Definition: The date on which the sample was received.
Guidance: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

Definition: The original sample description provided by the sample collector.
Guidance: Provide the sample description provided by the original sample collector. The original description is useful as it may provide further details, or can be used to clarify higher level classifications.

Definition: An environmental location may describe a site in the natural or built environment e.g. hospital, wet market, bat cave.
Guidance: If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the environmental site. The standardized term can be sourced from these look-up services: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/envo or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/genepio.

Definition: The depth of some water.
Guidance: Provide the depth of water with a value and unit.

Definition: The temperature of some air.
Guidance: Provide the temperature of the air with a value and unit. Do not provide a symbol for degree e.g. oC

Definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
Guidance: Provide the weather conditions at the time of sample collection.

Definition: The type of animal or plant population inhabiting an area.
Guidance: This field should be used when a sample is taken from an environmental location inhabited by many individuals of a specific type, rather than describing a sample taken from one particular host. If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the animal or plant population name. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/genepio. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: A substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment e.g. soil, water, sewage, door handle, bed handrail, face mask.
Guidance: If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the environmental material. The standardized term can be sourced from these look-up services: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/envo or https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/genepio. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: A substance obtained from an anatomical part of an organism e.g. tissue, blood.
Guidance: An anatomical material is a substance taken from the body. If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the anatomical material The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: A substance excreted/secreted from an organism e.g. feces, urine, sweat.
Guidance: A body product is a substance produced by the body but meant to be excreted/secreted (i.e. not part of the body). If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the body product. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: An anatomical part of an organism e.g. oropharynx.
Guidance: An anatomical part is a structure or location in the body. If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the anatomical material. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/uberon. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: A material consumed and digested for nutritional value or enjoyment.
Guidance: This field includes animal feed. If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the anatomical material. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/foodon. If not applicable, leave blank.
Examples: Feather meal [FOODON:00003927]; Bone meal [ENVO:02000054]; Chicken breast [FOODON:00002703]

Definition: Any characteristic of the food product pertaining to its state, processing, a label claim, or implications for consumers.
Guidance: Provide any characteristics of the food product including whether it has been cooked, processed, preserved, any known information about its state (e.g. raw, ready-to-eat), any known information about its containment (e.g. canned), and any information about a label claim (e.g. organic, fat-free).

Definition: The animal from which the food product was derived.
Guidance: Provide the common name of the animal. If not applicable, leave blank. Multiple entries can be provided, separated by a comma.

Definition: The type of packaging used to contain a food product.
Guidance: If known, provide information regarding how the food product was packaged.

Definition: A specification of the way that a specimen is or was stored.
Guidance: Provide a description of how the same was stored.

Definition: The material or matrix in which a sample is stored.
Guidance: Provide a description of the material or matrix used to store the sample.

Definition: The instrument or container used to collect the sample e.g. swab.
Guidance: This field includes animal feed. If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the anatomical material. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/genepio. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: The process used to collect the sample e.g. phlebotomy, necropsy.
Guidance: If applicable, provide the standardized term and ontology ID for the anatomical material. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/genepio. If not applicable, leave blank.

Definition: The commonly used name of the host.
Guidance: If the sample is directly from a host, either a common or scientific name must be provided (although both can be included, if known).  If known, provide the common name.

Definition: The taxonomic, or scientific name of the host.
Guidance: If the sample is directly from a host, either a common or scientific name must be provided (although both can be included, if known).  If known, provide the scientific name. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ncbitaxon.

Definition: The biotype resulting from selection in a particular habitat, e.g. the A. thaliana Ecotype Ler.
Guidance: Provide the name of the ecotype of the host organism.

Definition: A breed is a specific group of domestic animals or plants having homogeneous appearance, homogeneous behavior, and other characteristics that distinguish it from other animals or plants of the same species and that were arrived at through selective breeding.
Guidance: Provide the name of the breed of the host organism.

Definition: The name of the host at a certain stage of food production, which may depend on its age or stage of sexual maturity.
Guidance: Select the host's food production name from the pick list.

Definition: The name of the disease experienced by the host.
Guidance: This field is only required if the Pathogen.cl package was selected. If the host was sick, provide the name of the disease.The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/doid If the disease is not known, put “missing”.

Definition: The laboratory method used to grow, prepare, and/or isolate the microbial isolate.
Guidance: Provide the name and version number of the microbiological method. The ID of the method is also acceptable if the ID can be linked to the laboratory that created the procedure.

Definition: The strain identifier.
Guidance: A population or type of organisms that is genetically different from others of the same species and possessing a set of defined characteristics. If the isolate represents or is derived from, a lab reference strain or strain from a type culture collection, provide the strain identifier.

Definition: Identifier of the specific isolate.
Guidance: Provide the isolate_ID created by the lab that first isolated the isolate (i.e. the original isolate ID). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value. If only an alternate isolate ID is known (e.g. the ID from your lab, if your lab did not isolate the isolate from the original sample), make asure to include it in the alternative_isolate_ID field.

Definition: An alternative isolate_ID assigned to the isolate by another organization.
Guidance: If one or more alternative isolate_IDs are available, record them all here, separated by a comma.

Definition: The identifier assigned to a progenitor isolate derived from an isolate that was directly obtained from a sample.
Guidance: If your sequence data pertains to progeny of an original isolate, provide the progeny_isolate_ID.

Definition: The identifier of the isolate in the IRIDA platform.
Guidance: Provide the "sample ID" used to track information linked to the isolate in IRIDA. IRIDA sample IDs should be unqiue to avoid ID clash. This is very important in large Projects, especially when samples are shared from different organizations. Download the IRIDA sample ID and add it to the sample data in your spreadsheet as part of good data management practices.

Definition: The identifier of the Project in the iRIDA platform.
Guidance: Provide the IRIDA "project ID".

Definition: The name of the agency, organization or institution with which the individual who performed the isolation procedure is affiliated.
Guidance: Provide the name of the agency, organization or institution that isolated the original isolate in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The specific laboratory affiliation of the individual who performed the isolation procedure.
Guidance: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that that isolated the original isolate (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the isolate.
Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the isolate.
Guidance: Provide the email associated with the listed contact. As personnel turnover may render an individual's email obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide an address for a position or lab, to ensure accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The date on which the isolate was isolated from a sample.
Guidance: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

Definition: The date on which the isolate was received by the laboratory.
Guidance: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

Definition: Taxonomic name of the organism.
Guidance: Put the genus and species (and subspecies if applicable) of the bacteria, if known. The standardized term can be sourced from this look-up service: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/ncbitaxon.

Definition: The serovar of the organism.
Guidance: Only include this information if it has been determined by traditional serological methods or a validated in silico prediction tool e.g. SISTR.

Definition: The method used to determine the serovar.
Guidance: If the serovar was determined via traditional serotyping methods, put “Traditional serotyping”. If the serovar was determined via in silico methods, provide the name and version number of the software.

Definition: The phagetype of the organism.
Guidance: Provide if known. If unknown, put “missing”.

Definition: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.
Guidance: Every "library ID" from a single submitter must be unique. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible.

Definition: The name of the agency, organization or institution responsible for sequencing the isolate's genome.
Guidance: Provide the name of the agency, organization or institution that performed the sequencing in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The specific laboratory affiliation of the responsible for sequencing the isolate's genome.
Guidance: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that that performed the sequencing in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
Guidance: Provide the email associated with the listed contact. As personnel turnover may render an individual's email obsolete, it is more prefereable to provide an address for a position or lab, to ensure accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The reason that the sample was sequenced.
Guidance: Provide the reason for sequencing by selecting a value from the following pick list: Diagnostic testing, Surveillance, Monitoring, Clinical trial, Field experiment, Environmental testing. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the project/initiative/program for which sequencing was performed.
Guidance: Provide the name of the project and/or the project ID here. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The platform technology used to perform the sequencing.
Guidance: Provide the name of the company that created the sequencing instrument by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The model of the sequencing instrument used.
Guidance: Provide the model sequencing instrument by selecting a value from the template pick list. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.
Guidance: Provide the name of the library preparation kit used.

Definition: The protocol or method used for sequencing.
Guidance: Provide the name and version of the procedure or protocol used for sequencing. You can also provide a link to a protocol online.

Definition: The user-specified filename of the r1 FASTQ file.
Guidance: Provide the r1 FASTQ filename.

Definition: The user-specified filename of the r2 FASTQ file.
Guidance: Provide the r2 FASTQ filename.

Definition: The user-specified filename of the FAST5 file.
Guidance: Provide the FAST5 filename.

Definition: The user-defined filename of the FASTA file.
Guidance: Provide the FASTA filename.

Definition: The name of the agency that submitted the sequence to a database.
Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions. If submitting specimens rather than sequencing data, please put the "National Microbiology Laboratory (NML)".

Definition: The name or title of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the submission of the sequence to a repository or database.
Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is prefereable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The email address of the agency responsible for submission of the sequence.
Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or lab e.g. johnnyblogs@lab.ca, or RespLab@lab.ca

Definition: The identifier for a publication.
Guidance: If the isolate is associated with a published work which can provide additional information, provide the PubMed identifier of the publication. Other types of identifiers (e.g. DOI) are also acceptable.

Definition: The attribute package used to structure metadata in an INSDC BioSample.
Guidance: If the sample is from a specific human or animal, put “Pathogen.cl”. If the sample is from an environmental sample including food, feed, production facility, farm, water source, manure etc, put “Pathogen.env”.

Definition: The INSDC accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.
Guidance: Required if submission is linked to a BioProject. BioProjects are an organizing tool that links together raw sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. A valid BioProject accession has prefix PRJN, PRJE or PRJD, e.g., PRJNA12345 and is created once at the beginning of a new sequencing project. Your laboratory can have one or many BioProjects.

Definition: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC archives.
Guidance: Store the accession returned from the BioSample submission. NCBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMN, whileEMBL- EBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMEA.

Definition: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the INSDC.
Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted "run". NCBI-SRA accessions start with SRR, EBI-ENA runs start with ERR and DRA accessions start with DRR.

Definition: The GenBank/ENA/DDBJ identifier assigned to the sequence in the INSDC archives.
Guidance: Store the accession returned from a GenBank/ENA/DDBJ submission.

Definition: Metrics regarding the prevalence of the pathogen of interest obtained from a surveillance project.
Guidance: Risk assessment requires detailed information regarding the quantities of a pathogen in a specified location, commodity, or environment. As such, it is useful for risk assessors to know what types of information are available through documented methods and results. Provide the metric types that are available in the surveillance project sample plan by selecting them from the pick list. The metrics of interest are " Number of total samples collected", "Number of positive samples", "Average count of hazard organism", "Average count of indicator organism". You do not need to provide the actual values, just indicate that the information is available.
Examples: Number of total samples collected, Number of positive samples

Definition: The details pertaining to the prevalence metrics from a surveillance project.
Guidance: If there are details pertaining to samples or organism counts in the sample plan that might be informative, provide details using free text.
Examples: Hazard organism counts (i.e. Salmonella) do not distinguish between serovars.

Definition: The stage of food production.
Guidance: Provide the stage of food production from which the sample was taken. Select a value form the pick list provided.

Definition: The category of the experimental intervention applied in the food production system.
Guidance: In some surveys, a particular intervention in the food supply chain in studied. If there was an intervention specified in the sample plan, select the intervention category from the pick list provided.

Definition: The details of the experimental intervention applied in the food production system.
Guidance: If an experimental intervention was applied in the survey, provide details in this field as free text.

Definition: The name of the agent that kills or slows the growth of microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi and protozoans.
Guidance: The names of the drug have already been matched with measurement, breakpoint, and phenotype fields in the template. No need to add these unless the drug of interest is not present. Use the Term Request System to request the addition of other agents.

Definition: The name of the organization that performed the antimicrobial resistance testing.
Guidance: Provide the name of the agency, organization or institution that performed the AMR testing, in full (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the lab within the organization that performed the antimicrobial resistance testing.
Guidance: Provide the name of the specific laboratory that performed the AMR testing (avoid abbreviations). If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The name of the individual or the individual's role in the organization that performed the antimicrobial resistance testing.
Guidance: Provide the name of an individual or their job title. As personnel turnover may render the contact's name obsolete, it is more preferable to provide a job title for ensuring accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The email of the individual or the individual's role in the organization that performed the antimicrobial resistance testing.
Guidance: Provide the email associated with the listed contact. As personnel turnover may render an individual's email obsolete, it is more preferable to provide an address for a position or lab, to ensure accuracy of information and institutional memory. If the information is unknown or cannot be provided, leave blank or provide a null value.

Definition: The date the antimicrobial resistance testing was performed.
Guidance: Provide the date according to the ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD", "YYYY-MM" or "YYYY".

Definition: Antimicrobial resistance phenotype, as determined by the antibiotic susceptibility measurement and testing standard for this antibiotic
Guidance: Select a phenotype from the pick list provided.

Definition: The measured value of antimicrobial resistance.
Guidance: This field should only contain a number (either an integer or a number with decimals).

Definition: The units of the antimicrobial resistance measurement.
Guidance: Select the units from the pick list provided. Use the Term Request System to request the addition of other units if necessary.

Definition: The qualifier associated with the antibiotic resistance measurement
Guidance: Select the comparator sign from the pick list provided. Use the Term Request System to request the addition of other signs if necessary.

Definition: Maximum measurement, in the units specified in the “AMR_measurement_units” field, for a sample to be considered “sensitive” to this antibiotic
Guidance: This field should only contain a number (either an integer or a number with decimals), since the “<=” qualifier is implied.

Definition: Intermediate measurement(s), in the units specified in the “AMR_measurement_units” field, where a sample would be considered to have an “intermediate” phenotype for this antibiotic
Guidance: This field should only contain a number (either an integer or a number with decimals), since the qualifier is implied.

Definition: Minimum measurement, in the units specified in the “AMR_measurement_units” field, for a sample to be considered “resistant” to this antibiotic
Guidance: This field should only contain a number (either an integer or a number with decimals), since the “>=” qualifier is implied.

Definition: The general method used for antibiotic susceptibility testing.
Guidance: Select a typing method from the pick list provided. Use the Term Request System to request the addition of other methods if necessary.

Definition: The brand/platform used for antibiotic susceptibility testing
Guidance: Select a typing platform from the pick list provided. Use the Term Request System to request the addition of other platforms if necessary.

Definition: The specific name and version of the plate, panel, or other platform used for antibiotic susceptibility testing.
Guidance: Include any additional information about the antimicrobial susceptibility test such as the drug panel details.

Definition: The name of the vendor of the testing platform used.
Guidance: Provide the full name of the company (avoid abbreviations).

Definition: Testing standard used for determination of resistance phenotype
Guidance: Select a testing standard from the pick list provided.

Definition: Version number associated with the testing standard used for determination of resistance phenotype If applicable, include a version number for the testing standard used.
Guidance: If applicable, include a version number for the testing standard used.

Definition: Additional details associated with the testing standard used for determination of resistance phenotype
Guidance: This information may include the year or location where the testing standard was published. If not applicable, leave blank.
Examples: 27th ed. Wayne, PA: Clinical and Laboratory Standards Institute; 2017.
